symbols.title: namespace sap.fe.core

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.AppComponent
symbols.description:
Main class for components used for an application in SAP Fiori elements.

Application developers using the templates and macros provided by SAP Fiori elements should create their apps by extending this component. This ensures that all the necessary services that you need for the macros and templates to work properly are started.

When you use sap.fe.core.AppComponent as the base component, you also need to use a rootView. SAP Fiori elements provides two options:
- sap.fe.templates.RootContainer.view.NavContainer when using sap.m.routing.Router
- sap.fe.templates.RootContainer.view.Fcl when using sap.f.routing.Router (FCL use case)

methods.name: sap.fe.core.AppComponent.extend

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.fe.core.AppComponent with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.UIComponent.extend.

methods.name: getRootContainer

returnValue.description: reference to NavContainer control or the FCL control

methods.description: Get the NavContainer control or the FCL control.

methods.name: getRootViewController
methods.description: Get a reference to the nav/FCL Controller.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.AppComponent

If you need to maintain a specific state for your application, you can use the controller extension.

symbols.title: namespace sap.fe.core.controllerextensions

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.IntentBasedNavigation
symbols.description: A generic IntentBasedNavigation controller extension to be consumed by controllers for navigating to the external application

methods.name: adaptNavigationContext

parameters.name: oSelectionVariant
parameters.description: SelectionVariant that the template has prepared

parameters.name: oTargetInfo
parameters.description: SemanticObject and action of the target app

methods.description: Customize the sap.fe.navigation.SelectionVariant being passed to this navigation.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.IntentBasedNavigation

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.Routing
symbols.description: A controller extension offering hooks into the routing flow of the application

methods.name: onBeforeNavigation

returnValue.description: true to prevent the default execution, false to keep the standard behavior

parameters.name: oContextInfo
parameters.description: Object containing row context and page context

methods.description:
This function can be used to intercept the routing event happening during the normal process of navigating from one page to another.

If declared as an extension, it allows you to intercept and change the normal navigation flow. If you decide to do your own navigation processing, you can return `true` to prevent the default routing behavior.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.Routing

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.ViewState
symbols.description:
A controller extension offering hooks for state handling

If you need to maintain a specific state for your application, you can use the controller extension.

methods.name: adaptControlStateHandler

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: the control to get state handler for

parameters.name: aControlHandler
parameters.description: a list of plain objects with two functions: retrieve and apply

methods.description:
Customize the retrieve and apply functions for a certain control.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: adaptStateControls

parameters.name: aCollectedControls
parameters.description: the collected controls

methods.description:
This function should add all controls for given view that should be considered for the state handling to the provided control array.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: applyAdditionalStates

parameters.name: oViewState
parameters.description: the current view state

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Applying additional, not control related, states - is called only if navigation type is iAppState.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: applyInitialStateOnly

returnValue.description: whether applyViewState calls should be performed for current view

methods.description:
Returns whether view state should only applied once initially.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.Instead.

methods.name: applyNavigationParameters

parameters.name: oNavParameter
parameters.description: the current navigation parameter

parameters.name: navigationType
parameters.description: the actual navigation type

parameters.name: selectionVariant
parameters.description: the selectionVariant from the navigation

parameters.name: selectionVariantDefaults
parameters.description: the selectionVariant defaults from the navigation

parameters.name: requiresStandardVariant
parameters.description: defines whether standard variant must be used in VM

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Apply navigation parameters - is called only if navigation type is not iAppState.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: applyViewState

parameters.name: oViewState
parameters.description: the view state to apply (can be undefined)

parameters.name: oNavParameter
parameters.description: the current navigation parameter

parameters.name: navigationType
parameters.description: the actual navigation type

parameters.name: selectionVariant
parameters.description: the selectionVariant from the navigation

parameters.name: selectionVariantDefaults
parameters.description: the selectionVariant defaults from the navigation

parameters.name: requiresStandardVariant
parameters.description: defines whether standard variant must be used in VM

methods.description: Applies the given view state to this extensions view.

methods.name: onAfterStateApplied

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Hook to react when state for given view was applied.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: onBeforeStateApplied

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Hook to react before a state for given view is applied.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: retrieveAdditionalStates

parameters.name: mAdditionalStates
parameters.description: the additional state

methods.description:
Extend the map of additional states (not control bound) to be added to the current view state of the given view.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: retrieveViewState
methods.description: Retrieve the view state of this extensions view. When this function is called more than once before finishing, all but the final response will resolve to undefined.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.ViewState

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.PageController
symbols.description:
Base controller class for your custom page used inside a SAP Fiori elements application.

This controller provides preconfigured extensions that will ensure you have the basic functionalities required to use the macro.
symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.PageController
